dt: {bc}kept or set apart or aside for future or special use

pt: {sc}silent{/sc} {sc}taciturn{/sc} {sc}reticent{/sc} {sc}reserved{/sc} {sc}secretive{/sc} mean showing restraint in speaking. {sc}silent{/sc} implies a habit of saying no more than is needed.
{sc}taciturn{/sc} implies a temperamental disinclination to speech and usually connotes unsociability.
{sc}reticent{/sc} implies a reluctance to speak out or at length, especially about one's own affairs.
{sc}reserved{/sc} implies reticence and suggests the restraining influence of caution or formality in checking easy informal conversational exchange.
{sc}secretive{/sc}, too, implies reticence but usually carries a suggestion of deviousness and lack of frankness or of an often ostentatious will to conceal.

shortdef: kept or set apart or aside for future or special use

dt: {bc}to set aside (part of the consecrated elements) at the Eucharist for future use
{bc}to retain or hold over to a future time or place {bc}{sx|defer||}
{bc}to set or have set aside or apart

pt: {sc}keep{/sc} {sc}retain{/sc} {sc}detain{/sc} {sc}withhold{/sc} {sc}reserve{/sc} mean to hold in one's possession or under one's control. {sc}keep{/sc} may suggest a holding securely in one's possession, custody, or control.
{sc}retain{/sc} implies continued keeping, especially against threatened seizure or forced loss.

pt.t: managed to {it}retain{/it} their dignity even in poverty

pt: {sc}detain{/sc} suggests a delay in letting go.
{sc}withhold{/sc} implies restraint in letting go or a refusal to let go.
{sc}reserve{/sc} suggests a keeping in store for future use.

pt.t: {it}reserve{/it} some of your energy for the last mile

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French {it}reserver{/it}, from Latin {it}reservare{/it}, literally, to keep back, from {it}re-{/it} + {it}servare{/it} to keep {ma}{mat|conserve|}{/ma}
shortdef: to hold in reserve : keep back
to set aside (part of the consecrated elements) at the Eucharist for future use
to retain or hold over to a future time or place : defer

dt: {bc}a political power reserved by a constitution to the exclusive jurisdiction of a specified political authority

shortdef: a political power reserved by a constitution to the exclusive jurisdiction of a specified political authority
